entry.title: Jamie Kalven (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Chicago journalist Jamie Kalven (pictured) has amassed a database of nearly 250,000 allegations against police officers?

entry.title: 3C 120 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the active galaxy 3C 120 was given the variable-star designation BW Tauri because of its variability in the visible spectrum?

entry.title: Emily Dorothea Pavy (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in 1912, Emily Dorothea Pavy became the first recipient of the Catherine Helen Spence Scholarship?

entry.title: yellow discount stickers (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a British supermarket uses barriers to prevent shoppers grabbing food with yellow discount stickers out of the hands of staff?

entry.title: Milly Clegg (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that New Zealand footballer Milly Clegg was called "an absolute unicorn" after appearing at three FIFA World Cups in under twelve months?

entry.title: N.S.-Funk (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that unlike other German radio magazines of its era, N.S.-Funk was published in several regional editions?

entry.title: George Thomas Taylor (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that George Thomas Taylor was one of Canada's earliest nature photographers?

entry.title: Tarantella (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the only notable quality in Igor Stravinsky's "Tarantella", according to Richard Taruskin, is "how little talent it displays"?
